dct_title_s: The Turkish Empire in Europe, Asia and Africa
dct_description_sm: by H. Moll ; printed for H. Moll over against Devereux Court in ye Strand, and John Bowles at the Black Horse in Cornhill, T. Bowles print & mapseller next to the chapter house in St Pauls Church yard and by John King at the Globe in the Poultry.
Prime meridians: London and Ferro Island.
Coordinates approximate and based on Greenwich meridian.
Bar scale on map given in "Miles".
Shows topography, drainage, boundaries, land and sea travel routes, places of historical interest.

Features a decorative cartouche with a coat of arms and dedication: To the honourable Tho. Vernon Esqr. One of ye commiss.rs of trade and for ye plantations, of his majesty of Gr. Britain this map is humbly dedicated by your most humble servant Her. Moll Geographer.
2 pictorial vignettes: The inside of ye flat cupulo and ye appearance of ye outside of ye Holy Sepulcre -- The inside of ye Holy Sepulcre and ye grave of our saviour.

4 inset birds-eye view maps: [1] The plan of Constantinople -- [2] A draught of the city of Jerusalem as it is now, taken from the south east by Corneille Le Bruyn [with index] -- [3] The Church of the Holy Sepulcre &c [with index] -- [5] Smirna.
dct_publisher_sm: [H. Moll, J. Bowles, T. Bowles, J. King],
